title: Monster class
data:
All [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") belong to a **monster class**, based on the default [ASCII](/wiki/ASCII "ASCII") **monster symbol** that represents them. For some classes, such as x or w, the symbol is almost all that unites them. Other symbols represent monsters that share much in common, such as D or K. Additionally, some classes have individual members that are in many ways an "odd one out", such as E [stalkers](/wiki/Stalker "Stalker") and e [gas spores](/wiki/Gas_spore "Gas spore").

A blessed [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") allows you to wipe out some or all the species of a certain class. You can change the appearance of each class with the `monsters` option (3.4.3) or with [custom map symbols](/wiki/Custom_map_symbols "Custom map symbols") (3.6.0+). A common change is to display [ghosts](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") and [shades](/wiki/Shade "Shade") as X or 8 instead of   to make them more visible. However, this has no effect on the behaviour of genocide.

These descriptions are given in the game when you examine monsters with the [far look](/wiki/Far_look "Far look") [;](/wiki/Semicolon "Semicolon") or [what is](/wiki/What_is "What is") [/](/wiki/Slash "Slash") commands.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Some of the in-game descriptions are incomplete; extra information is italicized.

- [a](/wiki/Ant_or_other_insect "Ant or other insect"), [ant or other insect](/wiki/Ant_or_other_insect "Ant or other insect")
- [b](/wiki/Blob "Blob"), [blob](/wiki/Blob "Blob")
- [c](/wiki/Cockatrice_\(monster_class\) "Cockatrice (monster class)"), [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") *(or [pyrolisk](/wiki/Pyrolisk "Pyrolisk"))*
- [d](/wiki/Dog_or_other_canine "Dog or other canine"), [dog or other canine](/wiki/Dog_or_other_canine "Dog or other canine")
- [e](/wiki/Eye_or_sphere "Eye or sphere"), [eyes](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye") or [sphere](/wiki/E "E")
- [f](/wiki/Cat_or_other_feline "Cat or other feline"), [cat](/wiki/Cat "Cat") or other [feline](/wiki/Feline "Feline")
- [g](/wiki/Gremlin_\(monster_class\) "Gremlin (monster class)"), [gremlin](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin") *(or [gargoyle](/wiki/Gargoyle "Gargoyle"))*
- [h](/wiki/Humanoid_\(monster_class\) "Humanoid (monster class)"), [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid_\(monster_class\) "Humanoid (monster class)")
- [i](/wiki/Imp_or_minor_demon "Imp or minor demon"), [imp or minor demon](/wiki/Imp_or_minor_demon "Imp or minor demon")
- [j](/wiki/Jelly "Jelly"), [jelly](/wiki/Jelly "Jelly")
- [k](/wiki/Kobold_\(monster_class\) "Kobold (monster class)"), [kobold](/wiki/Kobold "Kobold")
- [l](/wiki/Leprechaun_\(monster_class\) "Leprechaun (monster class)"), [leprechaun](/wiki/Leprechaun_\(monster_class\) "Leprechaun (monster class)")
- [m](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic"), [mimic](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic")
- [n](/wiki/Nymph_\(monster_class\) "Nymph (monster class)"), [nymph](/wiki/Nymph_\(monster_class\) "Nymph (monster class)")
- [o](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)"), [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)") *(including [goblins](/wiki/Goblin "Goblin") and [hobgoblins](/wiki/Hobgoblin "Hobgoblin"))*
- [p](/wiki/Piercer "Piercer"), [piercer](/wiki/Piercer "Piercer")
- [q](/wiki/Quadruped "Quadruped"), [quadruped](/wiki/Quadruped "Quadruped")
- [r](/wiki/Rodent "Rodent"), [rodent](/wiki/Rodent "Rodent")
- [s](/wiki/Arachnid_or_centipede "Arachnid or centipede"), [arachnid or centipede](/wiki/Arachnid_or_centipede "Arachnid or centipede")
- [t](/wiki/Trapper_or_lurker_above "Trapper or lurker above"), [trapper or lurker above](/wiki/Trapper_or_lurker_above "Trapper or lurker above")
- [u](/wiki/Unicorn_or_horse "Unicorn or horse"), [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn") or [horse](/wiki/Horse "Horse")
- [v](/wiki/Vortex "Vortex"), [vortex](/wiki/Vortex "Vortex")
- [w](/wiki/Worm "Worm"), [worm](/wiki/Worm "Worm")
- [x](/wiki/Xan_or_other_mythical/fantastic_insect "Xan or other mythical/fantastic insect"), [xan or other mythical/fantastic insect](/wiki/Xan_or_other_mythical/fantastic_insect "Xan or other mythical/fantastic insect")
- [y](/wiki/Light_\(monster_class\) "Light (monster class)"), [light](/wiki/Light_\(monster_class\) "Light (monster class)")
- [z](/wiki/Zruty_\(monster_class\) "Zruty (monster class)"), [zruty](/wiki/Zruty_\(monster_class\) "Zruty (monster class)")
- [A](/wiki/Angelic_being "Angelic being"), [angelic being](/wiki/Angelic_being "Angelic being")
- [B](/wiki/Bat_or_bird "Bat or bird"), [bat or bird](/wiki/Bat_or_bird "Bat or bird")
- [C](/wiki/Centaur_\(monster_class\) "Centaur (monster class)"), [centaur](/wiki/Centaur_\(monster_class\) "Centaur (monster class)")
- [D](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon"), [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon")
- [E](/wiki/Elemental "Elemental"), [elemental](/wiki/Elemental "Elemental") *(or [stalker](/wiki/Stalker "Stalker"))*
- [F](/wiki/Fungus_or_mold "Fungus or mold"), [fungus](/wiki/Fungus "Fungus") or [mold](/wiki/Mold "Mold")
- [G](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_class\) "Gnome (monster class)"), [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_class\) "Gnome (monster class)")
- [H](/wiki/Giant_humanoid "Giant humanoid"), [Giant humanoid](/wiki/Giant_humanoid "Giant humanoid")
- [J](/wiki/Jabberwock_\(monster_class\) "Jabberwock (monster class)"), [jabberwock](/wiki/Jabberwock_\(monster_class\) "Jabberwock (monster class)")
- [K](/wiki/Keystone_Kop_\(monster_class\) "Keystone Kop (monster class)"), [Keystone Kop](/wiki/Keystone_Kop "Keystone Kop")
- [L](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)"), [lich](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)")
- [M](/wiki/Mummy "Mummy"), [mummy](/wiki/Mummy "Mummy")
- [N](/wiki/Naga "Naga"), [naga](/wiki/Naga "Naga")
- [O](/wiki/Ogre_\(monster_class\) "Ogre (monster class)"), [ogre](/wiki/Ogre_\(monster_class\) "Ogre (monster class)")
- [P](/wiki/Pudding_or_ooze "Pudding or ooze"), [pudding or ooze](/wiki/Pudding_or_ooze "Pudding or ooze")
- [Q](/wiki/Quantum_mechanic "Quantum mechanic"), [quantum mechanic](/wiki/Quantum_mechanic "Quantum mechanic")
- [R](/wiki/Rust_monster_or_disenchanter "Rust monster or disenchanter"), [rust monster or disenchanter](/wiki/Rust_monster_or_disenchanter "Rust monster or disenchanter")
- [S](/wiki/Snake_\(monster_class\) "Snake (monster class)"), [snake](/wiki/Snake "Snake")
- [T](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)"), [troll](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)")
- [U](/wiki/Umber_hulk_\(monster_class\) "Umber hulk (monster class)"), [umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk_\(monster_class\) "Umber hulk (monster class)")
- [V](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)"), [vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)")
- [W](/wiki/Wraith_\(monster_class\) "Wraith (monster class)"), [wraith](/wiki/Wraith_\(monster_class\) "Wraith (monster class)")
- [X](/wiki/Xorn_\(monster_class\) "Xorn (monster class)"), [xorn](/wiki/Xorn_\(monster_class\) "Xorn (monster class)")
- [Y](/wiki/Apelike_creature "Apelike creature"), [apelike creature](/wiki/Apelike_creature "Apelike creature")
- [Z](/wiki/Zombie_\(monster_class\) "Zombie (monster class)"), [zombie](/wiki/Zombie_\(monster_class\) "Zombie (monster class)")
- [@](/wiki/Human_or_elf "Human or elf"), [human or elf](/wiki/Human_or_elf "Human or elf")
- , [ghost](/wiki/Ghost_\(monster_class\) "Ghost (monster class)")
- ['](/wiki/Golem "Golem"), [golem](/wiki/Golem "Golem")
- [&](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon"), [(major) demon](/wiki/Demon_\(monster_class\) "Demon (monster class)")
- [;](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster"), [sea monster](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster")
- [:](/wiki/Lizard_\(monster_class\) "Lizard (monster class)"), [lizard](/wiki/Lizard_\(monster_class\) "Lizard (monster class)")

The [farlook](/wiki/Farlook "Farlook") ([;](/wiki/Semicolon "Semicolon")) and [whatis](/wiki/Whatis "Whatis") ([/](/wiki/Slash "Slash")) commands also show the following symbols, which are not monster classes:

- I, the remembered location of an unseen creature
- \~, part of the tail of a [long worm](/wiki/Long_worm "Long worm")
- ], one of the appearances of a [mimic](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic"), described by farlook as "a strange object".

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [drawing.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 160](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/drawing.c#line160 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/drawing.c"): *Monster descriptions*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [monsym.h in NetHack 3.4.3, line 81](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/monsym.h#line81 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/monsym.h"): *Default characters for monster classes*

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Monster class

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

All monsters belong to a monster class, based on the default ASCII monster symbol that represents them. For some classes, such as x or w, the symbol is almost all that unites them. Other symbols represent monsters that share much in common, such as D or K. Additionally, some classes have individual members that are in many ways an "odd one out", such as E stalkers and e gas spores.

A blessed scroll of genocide allows you to wipe out some or all the species of a certain class. You can change the appearance of each class with the monsters option (3.4.3) or with custom map symbols (3.6.0+). A common change is to display ghosts and shades as X or 8 instead of   to make them more visible. However, this has no effect on the behaviour of genocide.

These descriptions are given in the game when you examine monsters with the far look ; or what is / commands.[1][2] Some of the in-game descriptions are incomplete; extra information is italicized.

  • a, ant or other insect
  • b, blob
  • c, cockatrice (or pyrolisk)
  • d, dog or other canine
  • e, eyes or sphere
  • f, cat or other feline
  • g, gremlin (or gargoyle)
  • h, humanoid
  • i, imp or minor demon
  • j, jelly
  • k, kobold
  • l, leprechaun
  • m, mimic
  • n, nymph
  • o, orc (including goblins and hobgoblins)
  • p, piercer
  • q, quadruped
  • r, rodent
  • s, arachnid or centipede
  • t, trapper or lurker above
  • u, unicorn or horse
  • v, vortex
  • w, worm
  • x, xan or other mythical/fantastic insect
  • y, light
  • z, zruty
  • A, angelic being
  • B, bat or bird
  • C, centaur
  • D, dragon
  • E, elemental (or stalker)
  • F, fungus or mold
  • G, gnome
  • H, Giant humanoid
  • J, jabberwock
  • K, Keystone Kop
  • L, lich
  • M, mummy
  • N, naga
  • O, ogre
  • P, pudding or ooze
  • Q, quantum mechanic
  • R, rust monster or disenchanter
  • S, snake
  • T, troll
  • U, umber hulk
  • V, vampire
  • W, wraith
  • X, xorn
  • Y, apelike creature
  • Z, zombie
  • @, human or elf
  •  , ghost
  • ', golem
  • &, (major) demon
  • ;, sea monster
  • :, lizard

The farlook (;) and whatis (/) commands also show the following symbols, which are not monster classes:

  • I, the remembered location of an unseen creature
  • ~, part of the tail of a long worm
  • ], one of the appearances of a mimic, described by farlook as "a strange object".

References

  1. ↑ drawing.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 160: Monster descriptions
  2. ↑ monsym.h in NetHack 3.4.3, line 81: Default characters for monster classes

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

rawPage:
All [[monster]]s belong to a '''monster class''', based on the default [[ASCII]] '''monster symbol''' that represents them. For some classes, such as {{white|x}} or {{white|w}}, the symbol is almost all that unites them. Other symbols represent monsters that share much in common, such as {{white|D}} or {{white|K}}. Additionally, some classes have individual members that are in many ways an "odd one out", such as {{monsymlink|stalker}}s and {{monsymlink|gas spore}}s.

A blessed [[scroll of genocide]] allows you to wipe out some or all the species of a certain class. You can change the appearance of each class with the <tt>[[options#monsters|monsters]]</tt> option (3.4.3) or with [[custom map symbols]] (3.6.0+). A common change is to display [[ghost]]s and [[shade]]s as {{white|X}} or {{white|8}} instead of {{white| }} to make them more visible. However, this has no effect on the behaviour of genocide.

These descriptions are given in the game when you examine monsters with the [[far look]] {{kbd|;}} or [[what is]] {{kbd|/}} commands.{{refsrc|drawing.c|160|comment=Monster descriptions}}{{refsrc|monsym.h|81|comment=Default characters for monster classes}} Some of the in-game descriptions are incomplete; extra information is italicized.
*{{mcsl|a}}, [[ant or other insect]]
*{{mcsl|b}}, [[blob]]
*{{mcsl|c}}, [[cockatrice]] ''(or [[pyrolisk]])''
*{{mcsl|d}}, [[dog or other canine]]
*{{mcsl|e}}, [[floating eye|eyes]] or [[e|sphere]]
*{{mcsl|f}}, [[cat]] or other [[feline]]
*{{mcsl|g}}, [[gremlin]] ''(or [[gargoyle]])''
*{{mcsl|h}}, [[humanoid (monster class)|humanoid]]
*{{mcsl|i}}, [[imp or minor demon]]
*{{mcsl|j}}, [[jelly]]
*{{mcsl|k}}, [[kobold]]
*{{mcsl|l}}, [[leprechaun (monster class)|leprechaun]]
*{{mcsl|m}}, [[mimic]]
*{{mcsl|n}}, [[Nymph (monster class)|nymph]]
*{{mcsl|o}}, [[Orc (monster class)|orc]] ''(including [[goblin]]s and [[hobgoblin]]s)''
*{{mcsl|p}}, [[piercer]]
*{{mcsl|q}}, [[quadruped]]
*{{mcsl|r}}, [[rodent]]
*{{mcsl|s}}, [[arachnid or centipede]]
*{{mcsl|t}}, [[trapper or lurker above]]
*{{mcsl|u}}, [[unicorn]] or [[horse]]
*{{mcsl|v}}, [[vortex]]
*{{mcsl|w}}, [[worm]]
*{{mcsl|x}}, [[xan or other mythical/fantastic insect]]
*{{mcsl|y}}, [[Light (monster class)|light]]
*{{mcsl|z}}, [[Zruty (monster class)|zruty]]
*{{mcsl|A}}, [[angelic being]]
*{{mcsl|B}}, [[bat or bird]]
*{{mcsl|C}}, [[Centaur (monster class)|centaur]]
*{{mcsl|D}}, [[dragon]]
*{{mcsl|E}}, [[elemental]] ''(or [[stalker]])''
*{{mcsl|F}}, [[fungus]] or [[mold]]
*{{mcsl|G}}, [[Gnome (monster class)|gnome]]
*{{mcsl|H}}, [[Giant humanoid]]
*{{mcsl|J}}, [[Jabberwock (monster class)|jabberwock]]
*{{mcsl|K}}, [[Keystone Kop]]
*{{mcsl|L}}, [[Lich (monster class)|lich]]
*{{mcsl|M}}, [[mummy]]
*{{mcsl|N}}, [[naga]]
*{{mcsl|O}}, [[Ogre (monster class)|ogre]]
*{{mcsl|P}}, [[pudding or ooze]]
*{{mcsl|Q}}, [[quantum mechanic]]
*{{mcsl|R}}, [[rust monster or disenchanter]]
*{{mcsl|S}}, [[snake]]
*{{mcsl|T}}, [[Troll (monster class)|troll]]
*{{mcsl|U}}, [[Umber hulk (monster class)|umber hulk]]
*{{mcsl|V}}, [[Vampire (monster class)|vampire]]
*{{mcsl|W}}, [[Wraith (monster class)|wraith]]
*{{mcsl|X}}, [[Xorn (monster class)|xorn]]
*{{mcsl|Y}}, [[apelike creature]]
*{{mcsl|Z}}, [[Zombie (monster class)|zombie]]
*{{mcsl|@}}, [[human or elf]]
*{{mcsl| }}, [[Ghost (monster class)|ghost]]
*{{mcsl|'}}, [[golem]]
*{{mcsl|&}}, [[Demon (monster class)|(major) demon]]
*{{mcsl|;}}, [[sea monster]]
*{{mcsl|:}}, [[Lizard (monster class)|lizard]]

The [[farlook]] ({{kbd|;}}) and [[whatis]] ({{kbd|/}}) commands also show the following symbols, which are not monster classes:
*{{white|I}}, the remembered location of an unseen creature
*{{white|~}}, part of the tail of a [[long worm]]
*{{white|]}}, one of the appearances of a [[mimic]], described by farlook as "a strange object".
